ethnic.translation[0].definitions[0].def: relating to a particular race, nation, or tribe and their customs and traditions
ethnic.translation[0].definitions[0].not: ethnic violence/divisions/strife etc (=violence etc between people from different races or cultures)
ethnic.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The school teaches pupils from different ethnic groups.
plans to partition the republic along ethnic lines (=in a way that keeps different ethnic groups apart)
The students are from a variety of ethnic backgrounds.
ethnic.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: an ethnic group
People of Ukrainian descent are Canada’s fifth largest ethnic group.
an ethnic minority
Ethnic minorities have tended to live together in the same areas of the city.
ethnic origin/background
Schools are increasingly composed of pupils of different religions and different ethnic origins.
an ethnic Russian/Albanian etc
Romania’s 1.6 million ethnic Hungarians make up about 7 percent of the country’s population.
an ethnic mix
The city has a wonderful ethnic mix.
ethnic diversity
Chicago prides itself on its ethnic diversity.
ethnic violence/conflict
Hundreds were killed and injured in the country’s worst outbreak of ethnic violence.
ethnic divisions
Ethnic divisions continue to plague parts of America.
ethnic tension
It is feared that the growing ethnic tension could lead to civil war.
an ethnic identity
These small tribal communities share a common ethnic identity.
ethnic.translation[1].definitions[0].def: someone who comes from a group of people who are a different race, religion etc or who have a different background from most other people in that country
ethnic.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: In that neighborhood of New York, we were all ethnics.
